content.question: Which of the following most accurately explains how improvements in technology led to improvements in European living standards over the course of the twentieth century?

choices.label: Advances in the power of military technology led to a decrease in the willingness of countries to engage in warfare.
Advances in transportation allowed increasing numbers of Europeans to live in the countryside rather than the city.
Advances in medicine, food production, and public health contributed to increased life spans and improved quality of life.
Advances in communication technology allowed governments to have greater influence over individual citizensâ€™ lives.

content.answer: Advances in medicine, food production, and public health contributed to increased life spans and improved quality of life.
